content:
• Friday, April 27, 2012
  • CTCT

    Canaccord defends Constant Contact (CTCT -12.4%) after the company is hammered for missing FQ1...

    Canaccord defends Constant Contact (CTCT -12.4%) after the company is hammered for missing FQ1 EPS forecasts and guided for FQ2 EPS of $0.14-$0.15, below a consensus of $0.19. The firm thinks Constant Contact's 35K net customer adds for its social media marketing software is a positive, as is the $0.60 Q/Q increase in the company's ARPU.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:08 PM
  • FMCN

    Focus Media (FMCN +6.8%) spiked higher in late trading after filing a 20-F and an amended 6-K....

    Focus Media (FMCN +6.8%) spiked higher in late trading after filing a 20-F and an amended 6-K. In the 6-K, Focus restates its 2011 results to account for a $38.3M impairment loss related to its investment in VisionChina (NASDAQ:VISN). This results in its 2011 GAAP EPS falling to $1.17 from $1.45. However, its non-GAAP EPS remains fixed at $2.05. Frequent critic Muddy Waters isn't satisfied.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:24 PM
  • MXIM

    Needham and UBS praise Maxim Integrated's (MXIM +8.2%) after the company delivers an EPS beat...

    Needham and UBS praise Maxim Integrated's (MXIM +8.2%) after the company delivers an EPS beat and guides for FQ4 revenue of $590M-$620M and EPS of $0.34-$0.38 (consensus is for $601.9M and $0.34). Needham sees the analog chipmaker benefiting from rising industrial orders and heavy smartphone exposure, while UBS is pleased with management's remarks about the chip industry's inventory correction having ended (noteworthy given prior cautiousness).
     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 PM

  • Corn prices jump 4.6% after the U.S. reports the sixth-largest export sale ever for the grain,...

    Corn prices jump 4.6% after the U.S. reports the sixth-largest export sale ever for the grain, which analysts believe is headed for China. The sale coincides with expectations of a large Chinese purchase, but it renews concerns that Chinese demand could stretch already-tight U.S. inventories, pushing prices above their recent trading range.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • AET

    Coventry Health Care (CVH -8%) is one of the day's top losers, as a high-cost Medicaid issue in...

    Coventry Health Care (CVH -8%) is one of the day's top losers, as a high-cost Medicaid issue in Kentucky overshadowed Q1 results and the insurer lowered full-year guidance. Susquehanna calls disclosures around the full-year outlook "ambiguous," saying it was "disappointed with how management handled the significant guidance reduction."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • TPCG

    Shares of TPC Group (TPCG -12.3%) swoon on Q1 results showing the chemical company's revenue and...

    Shares of TPC Group (TPCG -12.3%) swoon on Q1 results showing the chemical company's revenue and earnings easily topping expectations, but the market appears to focus on a 16% decline in volume. Feedstock restrictions, which were responsible for the volume decline, are expected to continue due to planned ethylene plant outages.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM
  • VALE

    Brazil's Bovespa continues to drop, -0.8% today as VALE, already stung by diving earnings, has...

    Brazil's Bovespa continues to drop, -0.8% today as VALE, already stung by diving earnings, has its $5.9B potash project in Argentina threatened by Kirchner's shenanigans. Brazil's banks are also booking losses as the country enters the "not fun" part of a consumer credit boom. On the plus side, the central bank is aggressively cutting rates. The divergence between Brazil and the S&P.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM | 2 Comments
  • KO

    Shares of Coca-Cola (KO +1.4%) cruise to a 52-week high as a buy-the-split trading strategy (I,...

    Shares of Coca-Cola (KO +1.4%) cruise to a 52-week high as a buy-the-split trading strategy (I, II) continues to be bandied about. An interesting development to watch will be what will Warren Buffett do with Berkshire's sizable position after he famously pared back his stake in Kraft when it dared to propose issuing new shares against the Oracle's wisdom.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM | 10 Comments

  • June natural gas futures jump 2.8% to close at $2.186/MMBtu, highest in a month and capping a...

    June natural gas futures jump 2.8% to close at $2.186/MMBtu, highest in a month and capping a 15% spike in the past six sessions, as traders say the recent breach below $2 likely prompted increased usage from factories and utilities. IAFÂ Advisors' Kyle Cooper says the market may have seen the bottom: ”We’re just having very, very solid demand."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM
  • NXPI

    NXP Semiconductors (NXPI +5.4%) becomes the latest chipmaker to rally post-earnings (previous),...

    NXP Semiconductors (NXPI +5.4%) becomes the latest chipmaker to rally post-earnings (previous), after the company guides in its Q1 report for Q2 revenue of $1.05B (+8% Q/Q) and EPS of $0.40, above a consensus of $1B and $0.34. Jefferies (Buy) notes NXP's high-performance mixed-signal chip (HPMS) business, which makes up 80% of sales, outgrew its peers.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • VVUS

    Vivus (VVUS +4.5%) says the FDA has approved Stendra, also known as Avanafil, a new drug to...

    Vivus (VVUS +4.5%) says the FDA has approved Stendra, also known as Avanafil, a new drug to treat erectile dysfunction. Stendra is a pill that patients take on an as-needed basis 30 minutes before sexual activity, and is marketed by VVUS.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM | 14 Comments
  • RMD

    ResMed (RMD +7%) trades up after beating FQ3 consensus estimates late yesterday. Net income...

    ResMed (RMD +7%) trades up after beating FQ3 consensus estimates late yesterday. Net income jumped 21% Y/Y, driven by higher-than-expected gross margins from strong growth in masks and a shift to higher-margin flow generators. Separately, Goldman ups the shares to Buy on the back of the blowout quarter.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM
  • SYNA

    Synaptics' (SYNA -7.9%) FQ3 report provides more evidence of the troubles facing mobile...

    Synaptics' (SYNA -7.9%) FQ3 report provides more evidence of the troubles facing mobile suppliers with limited Apple/Samsung exposure. While the company says it's seeing rebounding demand for its notebook touchpads, it claims limited visibility for mobile touchscreen controller sales, due to "market share and sell-through dynamics" within its customer base. As a result, Synaptics expects FQ4 revenue of $133M-$140M, below a consensus of $149.5M. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • CMPR

    A down day for Vistaprint (VPRT -6.5%) looks somewhat mysterious after the firm beat top-line...

    A down day for Vistaprint (VPRT -6.5%) looks somewhat mysterious after the firm beat top-line and bottom-line expectations with its Q1 report and issued in-line 2012 guidance. That is unless you pull back that stock quote filter a bit to see that shares are still up for the week.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM | 3 Comments
  • PIKE

    Pike Electric (PIKE +7.1%) initiated with a Buy at Wunderlich, which believes the company is...

    Pike Electric (PIKE +7.1%) initiated with a Buy at Wunderlich, which believes the company is positioned for better growth than in the past. PIKE has taken advantage of the financial downturn to acquire undercapitalized firms while leveraging its own balance sheet into these new businesses, allowing it to expand its footprint across the U.S.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • TA

    Shares of TravelCenters (TA +8.9%) pick up steam after Raymond James chimes in with a resumed...

    Shares of TravelCenters (TA +8.9%) pick up steam after Raymond James chimes in with a resumed Outperform rating on the company. Of course, it's also not a bad day to have "travel" in your company name with a number of travel-industry names running hot off of Expedia's explosive Q1 earnings beat.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM
  • INFA

    Informatica (INFA -6.8%), which rallied strongly this year partly due to its big data exposure,...

    Informatica (INFA -6.8%), which rallied strongly this year partly due to its big data exposure, is selling off after beating Q1 estimates but guiding on its earnings call for Q2 revenue of $210M-$220M and EPS of $0.35-$0.37, below a consensus of $223.9M and $0.39. Informatica blames uncertain Euro demand, as well as higher sales/marketing spending. Guidance for 2012 revenue of $880M-$910M and EPS of $1.54-$1.64 is in-line with a consensus of $899.3M and $1.62.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM
  • ELY

    Callaway Golf (ELY -13.1%) sputters after it shanks one with its Q1 earnings report. The company...

    Callaway Golf (ELY -13.1%) sputters after it shanks one with its Q1 earnings report. The company suspended its expanded full-year outlook, saying only (rather enigmatically) that it expects "significant improvement" in 2012. Shares were down as much as 21% in intraday trading.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM | 1 Comment
  • JAZZ

    Jefferies says Jazz Pharmaceuticals' (JAZZ +16.6%) acquisition of EUSA will add $0.76 to its...

    Jefferies says Jazz Pharmaceuticals' (JAZZ +16.6%) acquisition of EUSA will add $0.76 to its FY13 earnings estimate and diversifies the company away from Xyrem. The firm now calls Jazz one of its top picks and raises its price target to $74.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • FIO

    Fusion-io (FIO -1.9%) pares the AH losses seen after beating FQ3 estimates but guiding for an...

    Fusion-io (FIO -1.9%) pares the AH losses seen after beating FQ3 estimates but guiding for an FQ4 op. margin decline. Possibly helping is an announcement Pandora has become a customer. Benchmark (Buy) is encouraged by strong sales to both server OEMs and direct customers such as Apple and Facebook, and thinks Fusion-io's ecosystem will help it stave off competition. It also sees new OEM qualifications and falling flash memory prices providing a lift.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM | 2 Comments
  • CPRI

    Shares of Michael Kors (KORS +3.5%) jump higher after sitting in negative territory most of the...

    Shares of Michael Kors (KORS +3.5%) jump higher after sitting in negative territory most of the day. Trader sentiment is split on the runup of the luxury brand retailer, with technicians seeing key resistance being breached while others maintain it's a delayed momentum play off the stock's bullish appearance on Mad Money.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • ARBA

    Ariba (ARBA +13.1%) is making 10-year highs following a solid FQ2 report, highlighted by a 59%...

    Ariba (ARBA +13.1%) is making 10-year highs following a solid FQ2 report, highlighted by a 59% sales jump for its business e-commerce network. In addition, subscription software sales rose 32%, evidence of Ariba's effective transition to a cloud model for its spend-management offerings. During its earnings call, Ariba guided for FY12 revenue of $525M-$535M and EPS of $0.96-$1.00, compared with a consensus of $528.2M and $0.95.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • GT

    Goodyear (GT -5.5%) says on an earnings CC that the company will target lucrative market...

    Goodyear (GT -5.5%) says on an earnings CC that the company will target lucrative market segments instead of making a play for high volume opportunities. The shift in strategy comes on the heels of a Q1 revenue miss after weak global demand led to a 8% Y/Y drop in tire volume during the period.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM
  • CRAY

    Two days after soaring on news of a technology sale to Intel, ancient supercomputer maker Cray...

    Two days after soaring on news of a technology sale to Intel, ancient supercomputer maker Cray (CRAY +21.9%) is taking off again thanks to a strong Q1 report, which the company attributes to orders from the DOE's Oak Ridge research facility. Shares are now up 54% from Tuesday's close. Cray is now guiding for 2012 revenue of $430M-$450M. far above a consensus of $404M. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM
  • ITMN

    Shares of InterMune (ITMN -14.5%) take a hit after posting a wider Q1 loss and missing on...

    Shares of InterMune (ITMN -14.5%) take a hit after posting a wider Q1 loss and missing on revenue estimates. Top line Esbriet sales came in short of reduced expectations, with just $4.9M in net sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • NR

    Shares of Newpark Resources (NR -11%) sink after Q1 earnings and revenues come in below analyst...

    Shares of Newpark Resources (NR -11%) sink after Q1 earnings and revenues come in below analyst estimates. Results were impacted by the deterioration in completion services and equipment rental business and reduced activity in certain dry gas regions in the U.S. NR says it is taking actions to address margin-related issues and remains focused on improving profitability.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • RSG

    Republic Services (RSG -12.2%) dips after missing Q1 estimates on slower sales and anemic...

    Republic Services (RSG -12.2%) dips after missing Q1 estimates on slower sales and anemic growth. Net profit fell 9.7% Y/Y on flat volume due to challenging market conditions. The company also lowers guidance for FY12 to $1.86 - $1.90 from $1.98 - $2.02. Street estimates for for an EPS of $2.01. Separately the company says its Tod Holmes will retire from his position effective May 1.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM | 2 Comments
  • ABAX

    Abaxis (ABAX +10.8%) pops after its FQ4 results easily topped estimates on a 14% Y/Y jump in...

    Abaxis (ABAX +10.8%) pops after its FQ4 results easily topped estimates on a 14% Y/Y jump in revenue. Net profit leapt 40% over the prior year period on a 25% jump in sales of medical and veterinary instruments.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE +13.4%) pops after saying its lithium-ion battery will be featured in the...

    A123 Systems (AONE +13.4%) pops after saying its lithium-ion battery will be featured in the Army's new tactical hybrid vehicle, called the FED Bravo, which is likely to be the next-generation of light tactical vehicles for the armed forces.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 5 Comments
  • EXPE

    Expedia (EXPE +29%) is off to the races following its huge Q1 beat, driven by strong hotel...

    Expedia (EXPE +29%) is off to the races following its huge Q1 beat, driven by strong hotel bookings, and is lifting other online travel firms in the process: PCLN +3.8%. OWW +9.1%. TRIP +7.7%. TZOO +3.6%. JPMorgan is upgrading Expedia in response, while Deutsche (Hold) thinks management's reiteration of its 2012 EBITDA forecast is "conservative in light of building momentum." Benchmark (Hold) agrees, though it expects growth to decelerate in Q2. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM | 3 Comments
  • OIS

    Oil States International (OIS +7%) shares surge as Q1 results handily top expectations as the...

    Oil States International (OIS +7%) shares surge as Q1 results handily top expectations as the company, which provides remote specialty services in the Canadian oil sands and the Australian mining regions, says the accommodations business in each of its major markets expanded and its offshore products business generated strong revenues.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM
  • WDC

    Western Digital (WDC -11.9%) and Seagate (STX -6.8%) dive after the FQ4 guidance that followed...

    Western Digital (WDC -11.9%) and Seagate (STX -6.8%) dive after the FQ4 guidance that followed WDC's stellar FQ3 report fails to impress, and the company says on its earnings call hard drive prices will fall Q/Q. Given the role expectations of continued pricing and margin strength (thanks to supply constraints) have played in this year's rally, that's not going over well. Also, WDC says near-term cost savings from the acquisition of Hitachi's hard drive business will be limited.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • TESS

    Shares of Tessco (TESS -20.7%) sink after the company warns that it will earn less in 2013 after...

    Shares of Tessco (TESS -20.7%) sink after the company warns that it will earn less in 2013 after losing a sizable portion of its business with one of its largest wireless customers (possibly AT&T). Even with the steep selloff, shares are up 40.4% YTD as they now trade with a stepped-up yield of 3.70%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • CHK

    There's a growing sense that "much more needs to be done" to restore confidence in Chesapeake...

    There's a growing sense that "much more needs to be done" to restore confidence in Chesapeake (CHK -2%) than only letting the Founders Well Participation Program expire. Analysts say the board should separate the chairman and CEO positions or even fire the whole bunch, but "given the litany of historic indications and most recent indications, this board appears to be incapable of doing that."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM | 9 Comments
  • AMFW

    Foster Wheeler (FWLT +1.5%) says a subsidiary of its Global Engineering and Construction Group...

    Foster Wheeler (FWLT +1.5%) says a subsidiary of its Global Engineering and Construction Group has won a contract from Cameron LNG, an affiliate of Sempra Energy (SRE +0.5%), to provide engineering for a new LNG liquefaction project to be located in Hackberry, Louisiana. The details of the project were not disclosed, but once completed the facility is expected to export up to 12M tons of LNG per year.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • DECK

    The dismantling of shares of Deckers (DECK -24.1%) could provide an opportunity, according to SA...

    The dismantling of shares of Deckers (DECK -24.1%) could provide an opportunity, according to SA author David Matusazk. While a mild winter and the high costs for lamb skins sit behind the scenes for a poor Q1, he sees new store openings and a return to more typical winters setting the tone for improved results over the long haul.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • RNF

    Rentech Nitrogen Partners (RNF +4.3%) announces its first distribution of $1.06/share and says...

    Rentech Nitrogen Partners (RNF +4.3%) announces its first distribution of $1.06/share and says it's "well positioned" to exceed its cash distribution forecast of $2.34 for the year ending Sept. 30. The company's costs: natural gas. The company's sales: fertilizer. A sweet spot to be in. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • AMZN

    As Amazon (AMZN +13%) takes off following its Q1 report, bulls are encouraged by its continued...

    As Amazon (AMZN +13%) takes off following its Q1 report, bulls are encouraged by its continued retail share gains and the 120 bps Y/Y increase in its gross margin, which was fueled by soaring e-book and web services revenue - RBC notes Amazon's GM jump is its largest in 10 years. Others, however, remain worried about Amazon's enormous spending growth. The company hired another 9,400 people in Q1, its biggest increase ever. (more) (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM
  • OUTR

    Coinstar (CSTR -4.1%) trades lower after posting revenue growth above the estimates of analysts...

    Coinstar (CSTR -4.1%) trades lower after posting revenue growth above the estimates of analysts in Q1 but disappointing investors with guidance for full-year 2012 a touch on the light side. With shares of CSTR up 42.8% YTD, trader sentiment is split on if the dip is worth buying.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • AWRE

    Biometrics and DSL software firm Aware (AWRE +59.7%) skyrockets after announcing (in tandem with...

    Biometrics and DSL software firm Aware (AWRE +59.7%) skyrockets after announcing (in tandem with its Q1 report) it's selling a portfolio of 4G, Wi-Fi, and home networking patents to Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) for $75M, and issuing a $1.15/share ($24M) special dividend. The sale proceeds make up over half of Aware's current market cap of $124M.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • TRW

    Shares of TRW Automotive (TRW +5.1%) perk up after trading in a relatively narrow range over the...

    Shares of TRW Automotive (TRW +5.1%) perk up after trading in a relatively narrow range over the last month. Ford's upwardly revised industry forecast for vehicle sales could be helping to tip sentiment bullish.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • BJRI

    Shares of BJ's Restaurants (BJRI -5.9%) fall off after slow growth kept the restaurant chain...

    Shares of BJ's Restaurants (BJRI -5.9%) fall off after slow growth kept the restaurant chain from meeting the expectation of analysts in Q1. The company says it remains in a growth mode on its view that it's one of the few casual dining names set to grow capacity in the double-digit range.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM
  • MXWL

    Maxwell Technologies (MXWL -37.6%) collapses after missing Q1 revenue estimates and providing...

    Maxwell Technologies (MXWL -37.6%) collapses after missing Q1 revenue estimates and providing soft guidance: the ultracapacitor maker expects Q2 revenue of $40.8M-$41.9M and 2012 growth of 15%-20%, below a consensus of $47.1M and 28%. Needham is defending Maxwell, arguing recent weakness is simply due to a pause in demand from the Euro wind power and hybrid bus markets, and its long-term story is intact. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • LEG

    Leggett & Platt (LEG -7.1%) trades lower after missing the estimates of analysts with its Q1...

    Leggett & Platt (LEG -7.1%) trades lower after missing the estimates of analysts with its Q1 report. While revenue increased Y/Y on high prices and currency gains, the firm's margins were squeezed by rising expenses.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • WDC

    SanDisk (SNDK) +2.1% thanks to an upgrade to Buy from Jefferies, a week after it was crushed due...

    SanDisk (SNDK) +2.1% thanks to an upgrade to Buy from Jefferies, a week after it was crushed due to its Q1 report and guidance. The firm sees a favorable mix and improving NAND flash prices boosting margins, and thinks SanDisk's $15/share in cash and IP licensing limit downside. The upgrade comes as Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) claims (.pdf) in its Q1 report NAND channel demand and spot prices were weak, though demand for embedded products (smartphones/tablets) was solid.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM
  • ONXX

    Shares of Onyx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ONXX) trail off 2.2% premarket on word that Warner...

    Shares of Onyx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ONXX) trail off 2.2% premarket on word that Warner Chilcott could be snapped up by a larger fish - possibly posing a competitive disadvantage to the biopharmaceutical firm.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • WCRX

    Shares of Warner Chilcott (NASDAQ:WCRX) spike 14.1% premarket after rumors churn up that Bayer...

    Shares of Warner Chilcott (NASDAQ:WCRX) spike 14.1% premarket after rumors churn up that Bayer (OTCPK:BAYRY) is poised to make a $32-a-share offer.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • EXPE

    Premarket gainers: EXPE +19%. AMZN +17%. JAZZ +15%. CRAY +12%. WCRX +12%. BPZ +6%. CBS +5%. AEM...

    Premarket gainers: EXPE +19%. AMZN +17%. JAZZ +15%. CRAY +12%. WCRX +12%. BPZ +6%. CBS +5%. AEM +5%. RTK +5%. ARNA +4%. GT +4%. CLWR +3%. SNY +3%. MT +3%. ARMH +3%.
    Losers: MDRX -42%. DECK -19%. WDC -11%. STX -7%. KOG -5%. SBUX -4%. FIO -4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM | 4 Comments
  • NEM

    Newmont Mining (NYSE:NEM): Q1 EPS of $1.17 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $2.68B (+% Y/Y) misses by...

    Newmont Mining (NYSE:NEM): Q1 EPS of $1.17 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $2.68B (+% Y/Y) misses by $0.8M. Shares +2.7% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM
  • PPC

    Shares of Pilgrim's Pride (NYSE:PPC) ride their most profitable Q1 since 2005 to a 5.8% gain...

    Shares of Pilgrim's Pride (NYSE:PPC) ride their most profitable Q1 since 2005 to a 5.8% gain premarket. The bird is the word, according to CEO Bill Lovette as he outlines the firm's strategy to find profits on the "whole bird" not just the high-margin breast area.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:53 AM
  • ATHX

    Athersys (NASDAQ:ATHX) +8.9% premarket after announcing its met with the FDA to discuss results...

    Athersys (NASDAQ:ATHX) +8.9% premarket after announcing its met with the FDA to discuss results of its recent clinical trial involving the administration of its MultiStem treatment for patients with leukemia or other conditions that place them at risk of graft vs. host disease.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:53 AM
  • KKR

    KKR & Co (NYSE:KKR): Q1 EPS of $0.99 beats by $0.033. Revenue of $116M (-49.% Y/Y) misses by...

    KKR & Co (NYSE:KKR): Q1 EPS of $0.99 beats by $0.033. Revenue of $116M (-49.% Y/Y) misses by $110M. Shares +1.8% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:52 AM
  • POZN

    Pozen (NASDAQ:POZN) -24.7% premarket after the biotech company discloses the FDA requested...

    Pozen (NASDAQ:POZN) -24.7% premarket after the biotech company discloses the FDA requested additional data for its PA32540 fixed-dose "safer aspirin" product which may delay submission of its new drug application.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM
  • PPC

    Pilgrim's Pride (NYSE:PPC): Q1 EPS of $0.18 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $1.9B (flat Y/Y) misses...

    Pilgrim's Pride (NYSE:PPC): Q1 EPS of $0.18 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $1.9B (flat Y/Y) misses by $60M. Shares +5.7% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:18 AM
  • NWL

    Newell Rubbermaid (NASDAQ:NWL): Q1 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $1.33B (+4.6% Y/Y)...

    Newell Rubbermaid (NASDAQ:NWL): Q1 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $1.33B (+4.6% Y/Y) beats by $30M. Shares +2.2% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:17 AM
  • AMZN

    Amazon's (NASDAQ:AMZN) high-flying Q1 report catches the eyes of Goldman Sachs' Heather Bellini...

    Amazon's (NASDAQ:AMZN) high-flying Q1 report catches the eyes of Goldman Sachs' Heather Bellini who upgrades shares to Conviction Buy from Neutral and boosts her price target to $300. In addition, BofA and SunTrust upgrade to Buy, but JMP Securities doesn't join the party - calling valuation "unattractive." AMZN +16.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM | 1 Comment
  • ARCB

    Arkansas Best (ABFS): Q1 EPS of -$0.71 may not be comparable to consensus of $-0.17. Revenue of...

    Arkansas Best (ABFS): Q1 EPS of -$0.71 may not be comparable to consensus of $-0.17. Revenue of $440.9M (+1.4% Y/Y) misses by $13M. Shares -7.9% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:42 AM
  • F

    More on Ford's (NYSE:F) Q1: North America unit records pre-tax profits of $2.1B. Automotive...

    More on Ford's (NYSE:F) Q1: North America unit records pre-tax profits of $2.1B. Automotive gross cash exceeded debt by $9.3B, up 98% Y/Y. Total vehicles wholesales 1.4M units, with lower wholesales in Europe and Pacific offset by strength in the Americas. Expects to stay on track with full-year metrics.
